page.title: 01 LEWES INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block includes river valley, floodplain and Downland, but it focusses on{Lewes, County Town of East {Sussex,}population approx.{15,000. Lewes lies on an east-facing slope of chalk Downs,where the{river Ouse}has cut through the South Downs escarpment on its way to the sea. The valley is very narrow at this point, giving firm ground for a river crossing, coupled with an easily defended site. So this{"gap town"}grew around a castle, and developed as a route centre and point of exchange: a market town dominating trade and economic activity over a wide area. Today, its public functions serve the county; it has many industries, social life takes many forms, particularly Bonfire. Its residents enjoy the historic town, but young people find its facilities restricting
